channel.title: Mining problem, need help please
channel.description:
I am trying to get the rock to turn into an empty rock when you mine the ore. The server base that I got started off with rocks that you can mine and after you get an ore from it you just keep mining it and don't stop. Even when you get a full inventory it would still mine it. I fixed all of that, and got it stopping after you mine it, and fixed the full inventory problem. My problem is getting the rock to turn into an empty rock. I got a copper rock turning into an empty rock after mining it, but when I mine other copper rocks, only that specific rock turns empty, the one that I mine does not. I edited it on the server side to do that. I looked everywhere for it on client side, but I can't find anything what so ever. Can anyone help me?
-Thanks in advance

No idea, don’t use PI or Python.

item.title: Mining problem, need help please
item.dc:creator: @dallas-harris dallas-harris
item.description:
@dallas-harris wrote:

def callback_mining_COPPER(player, id, x, y):
player.sendMessage(“You get some copper ore.”)
player.addItem(436, 1)
player.addSkillXP(17, 14);
player.resetAnimation()
PlayerManager.replaceObjectGlobal(x, y, 450, 0, 10)
TaskManager.registerClientTask(TaskFactory.getDelayedGlobalTask(“callback_mining_replace”, id, x, y), 3)

I am not too sure about what to do with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Mining problem, need help please
item.dc:creator: @dallas-harris dallas-harris
item.description:
@dallas-harris wrote:

Broken Britain:

Have a look through your files for a replaceObject method. A good way to find it would be to look in Wooductting or check another PI source’s mining.

I found it, but i’m not sure what to do with it. I have experimented and to me it seems like the .py files do nothing to the server, I changed things in them just to see if it would change them in the game, but it doesn’t. What are they for exactly?

Read full topic

item.title: Mining problem, need help please
item.dc:creator: @dallas-harris dallas-harris
item.description:
@dallas-harris wrote:

Here is the script.

public void startMining(int oreType, int levelReq, int exp) {
c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
c.getItems();
if (goodPick() > 0) {
if (c.playerLevel[c.playerMining] >= levelReq) {
if (freeSlots() >= 1) {
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(2090, 3289, 3363, 0, 10);
this.oreType = oreType;
this.exp = exp;
this.levelReq = levelReq;
this.pickType = goodPick();
c.sendMessage(“You swing your pick at the rock.”);
c.miningTimer = getMiningTimer(oreType);
c.startAnimation(EMOTE);
} else {
resetMining();
c.sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory”);
c.startAnimation(65535);
}
} else {
resetMining();
c.sendMessage(“You need a mining level of " + levelReq + " to mine this rock.”);
c.startAnimation(65535);
c.getPA().resetVariables();
}
} else {
resetMining();
c.sendMessage(“You need a pickaxe to mine this rock.”);
c.startAnimation(65535);
}
}
Here is where I added the objectSpawn for the empty rock.
public void mineOre() {
if (c.getItems().addItem(oreType,1)) {
c.sendMessage(“You manage to mine some ore.”);
c.getPA().addSkillXP(exp * Config.MINING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerMining);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(c.playerMining);
c.miningTimer = getMiningTimer(oreType);
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(450, 3289, 3363, 0, 10);
resetMining();
c.startAnimation(65535);
c.getPA().resetVariables();
if (Misc.random(25) == 10) {
c.getItems().addItem(RANDOM_GEMS[(int)(RANDOM_GEMS.length * Math.random())], 1);
c.sendMessage(“You find a gem!”);
c.sendMessage(“You need a mining level of " + levelReq + " to mine this rock.”);
c.startAnimation(65535);
}
} }

Read full topic
